item.text: Committee on Veterans' Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 115-215.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

summary.text:
Increasing Transferability of Entitlement to Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Act of 2017

This bill provides that in a case in which a post-9/11 educational assistance entitlement is transferred to a dependent and the service member transferor subsequently dies, the dependent may transfer some or all of such entitlement to another dependent to whom entitlement was already transferred by the service member.

bill.title: Increasing Transferability of Entitlement to Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Act of 2017

item.title: Increasing Transferability of Entitlement to Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Act of 2017

A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize a dependent to transfer entitlement to Post-9/11 Education Assistance in cases in which the dependent received the transfer of such entitlement to assistance from an individual who subsequently died, and for other purposes.
Increasing Transferability of Entitlement to Post-9/11 Educational Assistance Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Committee on Veterans' Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 115-215.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
